On Fast Algorithm for Computing
Even-Length DCT

front.div:
Abstract
We study recursive algorithm for computing DCT of lengths N = q 2
m (m, q âˆˆ N, q is odd) due
to C. W. Kok [16]. We show that this algorithm has the same multiplicative complexity as theoretically
achievable by the prime factor decomposition, when m 2. We also show that C. W. Kok's factorization
allows a simple conversion to a scaled form. We analyze complexity of such a scaled factorization,
and show that for some lengths it achieves lower multiplicative complexity than one of known prime
factor-based scaled transforms [14].
